item.title: Using the "nonwild" boolean to make areas nonwild?
item.dc:creator: @_Java1 † Java †
item.description:
@_Java1 wrote:

I stumbled across the boolean a bit ago, and i need to edit my safe areas, how do i add them to the boolean?

public boolean nonWild() { if((absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3258 && absY >= 3438 && absY <=3431 ) || (absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3260 && absY >=3435 && absY <=3437 ) || (absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3253 && absY >=3431 && absY <=3437 ) || (absX >=3250 && absX <=3257 && absY >=3419 && absY <=3423 ) ||(absX >=3250 && absX <=3257 && absY >=3419 && absY <=3423 )||(absX >=3156 && absX <=3277 && absY >=3374 && absY <=3514 )||(absX >=2759 && absX <=2761 && absY >=2764 && absY <=2772 )||(absX >=2762 && absX <=2767 && absY >=2764 && absY <=2766 )||(absX >=2768 && absX <=2770 && absY >=2764 && absY <=2772 )|| heightLevel == 1) return true; else return false; }

Read full topic
item.source: Using the "nonwild" boolean to make areas nonwild?
